channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging tree, 27th August
item.description:
This is overhanging a pavement to a height that has to be avoided This needs to be trimmed back by resident This has got progressively worse over the years It is difficult to pass when tall especially with buggy
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Saint Michaels Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead badger on hard shoulder A46 turn off from Crickly Hill, 27th August
item.description:
Dead badger on hard shoulder just after slip road to the A46 roundabout - heading west towards M5 junction ///boardroom.draining.bleat
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 27th August
item.description:
Give and take 28 day plus temporary footway closure footway abrupt level differents around stw cover 300x300x35mm tarmac patch stats required (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -other CW10 problem, 27th August
item.description:
C/W depression patch - 1000mm x 1000mm x 55mm - ENWD - Lane closure (CW10 Rutting&Depressions)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag painted on roundabout, 27th August
item.description:
Mini Roundabout off Village Road connecting onto Hayden Road. English flag painted on mini roundabout, currently a political message. Wondering if and when it will be painted back?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 27th August
item.description:
Give and take 28 day plus temporary footway closure footway abrupt level different due to tree roots please remove x1 raised 750x600x20mm slab and replace with tarmac patch number 1 (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
Report on FixMyStreet
